sentences.english: MBL's work is truly amazing, thank you for letting me be a part of it.
sentences.chinese: MBL的工作確實是驚人的，謝謝你讓我成爲一部分。

sentences.english: BE, baby yesterday is also individually see, definite is very exquisite.
sentences.chinese: 是，孩兒昨天也是親眼所見，確實是非常玄妙。

sentences.english: He's a good lecturer as he really knows his stuff.
sentences.chinese: 他是位好講師，因爲他確實精通業務。

sentences.english: He called it a narrow escape. But it was really a cliff-hanger .
sentences.chinese: 他稱之爲僥倖逃脫，但那確實讓他膽戰心驚。

sentences.english: But it is their responsibility, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 但那確實是他們的責任，”他說。

sentences.english: Indeed, there are a fair number of Mr. Lonelyhearts on campus.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，孤獨先生在校園裏確實不少。

sentences.english: " Indeed, " Geocentric Adventure" is in theaters Not quiet.
sentences.chinese: 確實，《地心歷險記》的放映廳裏很不安靜。

sentences.english: But we do know that it will happen.
sentences.chinese: 但我們確實知道這將會發生。

sentences.english: The woman's beauty made her a rare bird indeed.
sentences.chinese: 美貌確實使她成了一個絕世佳人。

sentences.english: China a can really help Bihar.
sentences.chinese: 中國確實能夠幫助比哈爾。

sentences.english: He does everything his wife says; She really leads him by the nose .
sentences.chinese: 他對妻子惟命是從，確實被妻子牽着鼻子走的。

sentences.english: 'There's a real small chance but it's still a must-win game.
sentences.chinese: 可能性確實不大，但是我們必須拿下。

sentences.english: Yes, certainly there's a relationship between these two guys.
sentences.chinese: 有，這兩人之間確實有一段情。

sentences.english: Now that the exam is near, the students are really going at their studies.
sentences.chinese: 考期臨近了，所以學生們確實在刻苦鑽研。

sentences.english: There is also a very real risk of follow-on effects.
sentences.chinese: 確實還存在後繼效應風險。

sentences.english: Some things are going to slide through, and that's actually a bother. It's a problem.
sentences.chinese: 有些問題會躲過檢查，這確實很煩，這是個問題。

definition: after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
